task.title: Troubleshooting the inability to add a cluster
task.shortdesc: Immediate actions to take when a cluster cannot be added to .

context.p: If you have attempted to target a new cluster but you cannot get the addition acknowledged within , then use the following steps to isolate and resolve the problem. This situation can arise for clusters deployed in either execution or submission roles.

steps.stepsection: To troubleshoot why a cluster cannot be added:

step.cmd: If you fail to receive any message during the cluster reporting poll, then try directly polling the unresponsive cluster directly.

substep.cmd: In Configuration Tool Connections task, select the applicable cluster.
At the bottom of the Connections task, click Poll.

ul.li: If there is no reply, the cluster may be offline (the hardware infrastructure could be malfunctioning), or there is a problem with your network connectivity. Contact the approriate system administrators in order to isolate any problems at the physical connectivity layer.
If you can poll the cluster, and get a response, then continue with the next step.

step.cmd: Open the clusterâ€™s configuration web page by typing its IP address into the configuration lookup panel.
step.info: This is also where you can determine if you have the correct credentials for the cluster.

substep.cmd: In Configuration Tool Control task, select select the applicable cluster.
At the bottom of the Configuration Tool Control task panel, click Reboot.

step.cmd: Try adding the cluster to again.
Make sure the hardware configuration deployed for the cluster is supported by , and that it is running the certified firmware.
step.info: For a list of supported hardware configurations, and for known compatibility issues, see the register of supported hardware.

step.cmd: Make sure you are using the correct credentials when trying to add the unit. For some hardware manufacturers, you may have to set the default credentials for the respective hardware before resetting the credentials after the cluster has been added.

substep.cmd: Consult the hardware manufacturer's reference documentation in order to locate the default credentials for the applicable hardware.
Reset the hardware to the default credentials using the applicable hardware configuration interface.
In , access the Configuration Tool Set up task.
Click the Add Clusters tab.
To add the new cluster unit, click Add a cluster, select the extension type, and click Add.
When prompted by the Enter credentials dialogue, input the default hardware credentials.
Select the new cluster.
In the Default logon section, enter the new username and password for the cluster.

step.cmd: Make sure the Cluster is connected to the correct database, as follows:

substep.cmd: In Configuration Tool Cluster task, select the the applicable cluster.
Click the Resources tab.

ul.li: If the database status is Connected, go to the next step.

If the database status is Disconnected or Unavailable, click Connect to database.
Do not overwrite the disconnected or unavailable database connection, as this can lead to data loss. Be use to save copies of any database connection configurations before deleting or modifying them. When you create a new database connection, searches or administrative routines that were in place for previous connections will need to be respecified for the new database connection.

step.cmd: Make sure the associated execution clusters are also connected to the correct database.
step.info: If there is an issue with associated execution clusters, this may be a sign that there are more serious problems with the configuration of the environment or with the network environment.

substep.cmd: In Configuration Tool System task, select the Job Router.
Click the Resources tab.

ul.li: If the Job Router database status is Connected, go to the next step.
If the Job Router database status is Disconnected or Unavailable, click Connect to database .

step.cmd: Try adding the unit with the network firewall turned off. This will determine if the problems are related to interference in network connectivity due to secutity settings.
step.info: For information about how to disable the network firewall, request assistance from your network administrator. Do not turn off the firewall permanently. Reactivate it after your tests are complete.

step.cmd: Make sure your networks are configured properly, as follows:

substep.cmd: In the Configuration Tool Network view task, select a network.
Click the Properties tab, and make sure all the settings are correct (IP prefix, subnet mask, routes, and so on).
Initiate a network diagnosis by selecting Test Network.
Repeat these steps for all the networks on your system.

step.info: This activity should be done in collaboration with your network administrators.

step.cmd: Make sure the Cluster, Job Router, and all redirectors are using the correct addresses in their requests.

substep.cmd: In the Configuration Tool System task, click the Directory view.
Select the Physical view, and click the Resources tab.
From the Resources drop-down list, select the appropriate resources in sequence and verify the associated network addresses.
In the Logical view, select the Job Router role, and click the Resources tab.
Under the Servers section, click Advanced.
Select the appropriate Network address for each server, and click Validate.
Click the Properties tab.
Select a Redirector, and click Edit the item.
From the cluster interface drop-down list, select the appropriate cluster.
Repeat the last two steps for each redirector.

step.cmd: Make sure the Job Router process is online, as follows:

substep.cmd: In the Config Tool System task, select the Job Router process.
At the bottom of the System task, click Diagnose.
If there are issues, try to fix them.

step.cmd: Make sure the database is online, as follows:

substep.cmd: In the Config Tool System task, select the Database.
substep.info: Confirm that the correct Database has been selected.

substep.cmd: At the bottom of the System task, click Diagnose.
substep.info: The diagnosis process will identify a series of issues. The most common issues relate to incorrect identifiers having been included in the Database.

substep.cmd: For each of the issues identified, take corrective action as directed by the diagnosis instructions.

step.cmd: Make sure the Execution Clusters are online, as follows:

substep.cmd: In the Config Tool System task, select each of the applicable Clusters.
At the bottom of the System task, click Diagnose.
For each of the issues identified, take corrective action as directed by the diagnosis instructions.

step.cmd: If you still cannot add the cluster, contact technical support.
